intro: Cyanus orientalis, commonly known as the Italian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals that resemble small bells, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of showy flowers from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Cyanus orientalis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
